prompts.createTask: Pause your roleplay. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Pause your roleplay. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.

name: Info & Guidance for AI Crafting Response
mes:
Here is some background about Stefan, Suzanne, and Melissa:

Stefan and Suzanne are both in their early forties and both natives of Munich, Germany. They got married in April of 2016, eight years ago. Together, they have two daughters. The oldest is seven years old. The other is five years old.

Melissa is a woman that met Stefan and Suzanne four months ago. There was strong connection between Melissa and Stefan, although they did not act on it, and maintain respectful boundaries.
original_avatar: Info & Guidance for AI Crafting Response.png
swipes:

Melissa is a woman that met Stefan and Suzanne four months ago. There was strong connection between Melissa and Stefan, although they did not act on it, and maintain respectful boundaries.

name: Melissa Gale
mes:
I have provided you with a horary chart that I have drawn up specifically asking: Are Stefan, his wife, and kids truly sick with illness like he has indicated right now?

Stefan should be represented by the 9th house (foreign connection) and Me by the Ascendant.

I've provided a cross reference guide to help identify the houses concerning him due to his 9th house representation.

Please start by listing all relevant chart data for interpretation (ie. transits, aspects, patterns, etc.) from the horary chart using horary principles only. Then I will document them for the actual interpretations.

Remember to follow your directives and maintain accuracy to what is shown in the chart data. Think step by step taking a methodical approach.

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes:
Below is a full listing of the horary chart data derived solely from the provided information using horary principles for your query:

1. Planetary Placements (using the provided chart details):
 • Sun at 15° Aquarius
 • Moon at 24° Aries
 • Mercury at 11° Aquarius
 • Venus at 29° Pisces
 • Mars at 19° Cancer (Retrograde)
 • Jupiter at 11° Gemini (Retrograde)
 • Saturn at 17° Pisces
 • Uranus at 23° Taurus
 • Neptune at 28° Pisces
 • Pluto at 2° Aquarius
 • North Node at 29° Pisces (Retrograde)
 • Chiron at 19° Aries
 • Ascendant (Melissa) at 15°43′ Gemini
 • Midheaven (MC) at 19° Aquarius
 • Imum Coeli (IC) at 19° Leo

2. House Cusps (as provided for this chart):
 • 1st House: begins at 15° Gemini
 • 2nd House: begins at 10° Cancer (containing Mars)
 • 3rd House: begins at 29° Cancer
 • 4th House: begins at 19° Leo
 • 5th House: begins at 19° Virgo
 • 6th House: begins at 5° Scorpio
 • 7th House: begins at 15° Sagittarius
 • 8th House: begins at 10° Capricorn
 • 9th House: begins at 29° Capricorn (noted as containing Sun, Mercury, and Pluto)
 • 10th House: begins at 19° Aquarius (containing Saturn)
 • 11th House: begins at 19° Pisces (containing Moon, Venus, Neptune, North Node, and Chiron)
 • 12th House: begins at 5° Taurus (containing Jupiter and Uranus)

3. Relevant House Cross‑Reference for Stefan
 Stefan is to be represented by the 9th house in the query. Using the provided cross‑reference guide for Stefan’s houses (shifting by three houses):
  – Chart’s 1st House corresponds to Stefan’s 4th House
  – Chart’s 2nd House corresponds to Stefan’s 5th House
  – Chart’s 3rd House corresponds to Stefan’s 6th House
  – Chart’s 4th House corresponds to Stefan’s 7th House
  – Chart’s 5th House corresponds to Stefan’s 8th House
  – Chart’s 6th House corresponds to Stefan’s 9th House
  – Chart’s 7th House corresponds to Stefan’s 10th House
  – Chart’s 8th House corresponds to Stefan’s 11th House
  – Chart’s 9th House corresponds to Stefan’s 12th House
  – Chart’s 10th House corresponds to Stefan’s 1st House
  – Chart’s 11th House corresponds to Stefan’s 2nd House
  – Chart’s 12th House corresponds to Stefan’s 3rd House
This mapping will be employed later to isolate indicators related to illness for Stefan’s representation (notably using the Stefan equivalent of the 6th house for health matters).

4. Major Aspects (with given orbs):
 • Chiron sextile MC (orb: 0°)
 • Mars square Chiron (orb: 0°)
 • MC opposition IC (orb: 0°)
 • Venus conjunction North Node (orb: 0°)
 • Chiron trine IC (orb: 0°)
 • Mercury trine Jupiter (orb: 0°)
 • Sun trine Ascendant (orb: 0°)
 • Neptune conjunction North Node (orb: 1°)
 • Venus conjunction Neptune (orb: 1°)
 • Saturn square Ascendant (orb: 2°)
 • Mars trine Saturn (orb: 2°)
 • Pluto sextile North Node (orb: 3°)
 • Venus sextile Pluto (orb: 3°)
 • Ascendant sextile IC (orb: 4°)
 • Chiron sextile Ascendant (orb: 4°)
 • Mars sextile Uranus (orb: 4°)
 • Sun sextile Chiron (orb: 4°)
 • Uranus square IC (orb: 4°)
 • Uranus square MC (orb: 4°)
 • Sun opposition IC (orb: 4°)
 • Jupiter conjunction Ascendant (orb: 4°)
 • Sun conjunction MC (orb: 4°)
 • Sun conjunction Mercury (orb: 4°)
 • Ascendant trine MC (orb: 4°)
 • Mercury trine Ascendant (orb: 4°)
 • Sun trine Jupiter (orb: 4°)
 • Uranus sextile Neptune (orb: 5°)
 • Moon sextile MC (orb: 5°)
 • Moon square Mars (orb: 5°)
 • Moon conjunction Chiron (orb: 5°)
 • Moon trine IC (orb: 5°)
 • Saturn sextile Uranus (orb: 6°)
 • Venus sextile Uranus (orb: 6°)
 • Jupiter square Saturn (orb: 6°)
 • Mercury opposition IC (orb: 8°)
 • Mercury conjunction MC (orb: 8°)
 • Jupiter trine MC (orb: 8°)

5. Patterns Noted in the Chart:
 • T‑Square: Involving MC at 19° Aquarius, Uranus at 23° Taurus, and IC at 19° Leo
 • Cradle Pattern: Involving the Sun at 15° Aquarius, IC at 19° Leo, Ascendant at 15° Gemini, Chiron at 19° Aries, and MC at 19° Aquarius

6. Additional Chart Characteristics:
 • Moon is observed as a waxing crescent
 • The chart presents a Bowl configuration
 • Dominance of the Air element among the inner planets
 • The bottom right quadrant of the chart remains empty, while most planets cluster in the top left quadrant
 • Jupiter is noted as “rising” in the sense of its prominence
 • The Sun and Mercury are positioned on the Midheaven; the IC represents the Nadir
 • A total of 11 sextile aspects occur, making this the most common aspect in the chart
 • The MC is involved in 12 aspects
 • The Moon (in Aries) and Mars (in Cancer) are in mutual reception
 • Neptune in Pisces sits in its own rulership

This compilation represents the complete set of chart data—including planetary placements, houses (and their corresponding Stefan cross‑reference), major aspects, significant patterns, and additional chart features—needed for a methodical, horary analysis of your query regarding the sickness of Stefan, his wife, and children.

name: Melissa Gale
mes: Thank you, Madame. Please, proceed to interpretation.

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes:
Based on the horary data provided, the following indications arise regarding Stefan, his wife, and the children’s reported illness:

1. Stefan’s representation is anchored in the 9th house and, via the provided cross‑reference, corresponds to the chart’s 6th house—the traditional indicator for health. In this chart the 6th house cusp falls at 5° Scorpio and is notably empty of planets. An empty 6th house often indicates that there are minimal direct or chronic health afflictions at play. This points toward issues that may be transient or overstated rather than deeply rooted illness.

2. The presence of the Sun, Mercury, and Pluto in the 9th house (in Capricorn, with the 9th cusp at 29° Capricorn) suggests that the subject’s matters are being observed under an influence of transformation and sometimes intense communication. Pluto can intensify matters, but without significant planetary occupancy in the directly health‐related sector (the 6th) the severity is limited. Mercury’s involvement may hint at miscommunication or exaggeration in how the illness is reported.

3. The sharp Mars square Chiron (both near 19° in Cancer/Aries, with an orb of 0°) denotes a notable tension between physical vitality and the wound or injury indicator. While this aspect can signal episodes of pain or discomfort, its presence does not automatically imply a deep or chronic condition—it often reflects acute symptoms that cause considerable discomfort without necessarily undermining overall health.

4. Additional aspects that provide context include Saturn square the Ascendant (orb of 2°), which points to burdens or limitations affecting either perception or immediate circumstances. In a horary context, this can sometimes indicate that hardships are either being over‐emphasized or are temporary in nature. The support offered by sextile aspects (such as Sun sextile Chiron and Mercury trine Jupiter) contributes to a mitigating tone, suggesting that any difficulties may be resolved or balanced by more harmonious influences.

5. The T‑Square involving the Midheaven in Aquarius, Uranus in Taurus, and the Imum Coeli in Leo introduces sudden disruptions and unpredictability. Though this formation carries a note of tension, it tends to manifest as intermittent or stress‐related disruptions rather than a definitive debilitating condition.

In sum, the chart indicates that while there is evidence of discomfort and acute symptoms (as seen through the Mars–Chiron square), the overall indicators do not point to a significant, ongoing, or severe illness within Stefan’s household. The empty 6th house, in combination with supportive aspects elsewhere, strongly suggests that the reported illness may be temporary or less serious than indicated.

2. The presence of the Sun, Mercury, and Pluto in the 9th house (in Capricorn, with the 9th cusp at 29° Capricorn) suggests that the subject’s matters are being observed under an influence of transformation and sometimes intense communication. Pluto can intensify matters, but without significant planetary occupancy in the directly health‐related sector (the 6th) the severity is limited. Mercury’s involvement may hint at miscommunication or exaggeration in how the illness is reported.

3. The sharp Mars square Chiron (both near 19° in Cancer/Aries, with an orb of 0°) denotes a notable tension between physical vitality and the wound or injury indicator. While this aspect can signal episodes of pain or discomfort, its presence does not automatically imply a deep or chronic condition—it often reflects acute symptoms that cause considerable discomfort without necessarily undermining overall health.

4. Additional aspects that provide context include Saturn square the Ascendant (orb of 2°), which points to burdens or limitations affecting either perception or immediate circumstances. In a horary context, this can sometimes indicate that hardships are either being over‐emphasized or are temporary in nature. The support offered by sextile aspects (such as Sun sextile Chiron and Mercury trine Jupiter) contributes to a mitigating tone, suggesting that any difficulties may be resolved or balanced by more harmonious influences.

5. The T‑Square involving the Midheaven in Aquarius, Uranus in Taurus, and the Imum Coeli in Leo introduces sudden disruptions and unpredictability. Though this formation carries a note of tension, it tends to manifest as intermittent or stress‐related disruptions rather than a definitive debilitating condition.

In sum, the chart indicates that while there is evidence of discomfort and acute symptoms (as seen through the Mars–Chiron square), the overall indicators do not point to a significant, ongoing, or severe illness within Stefan’s household. The empty 6th house, in combination with supportive aspects elsewhere, strongly suggests that the reported illness may be temporary or less serious than indicated.

mes: Are Stefan's kids really sick? February 3rd, 2025.  Conclusion, no.
